author: heinz.gassner
title: Enabling Micro-Summits in 2022
description: 催化剂引发了数以百计的项目，许多项目以孤岛模式运行，导致大量冗余和缺乏共同学习。

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge is crucial for Cardano's mission. Pointing to closed, tribal development in the community, the challenge wants to provide fertile ground for effective solutions for cooperation and shared learning. I strongly agree for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: My understanding of the challenge brief, leads me to assume, that this challenge is meant to be a bootstrap for projects, that will create 12 to 24 venues over next 12 months. Furthermore, the challenge is expressed as "Micro-Summits", in real life events where the challenge budget is covering actual costs for carefully selected participants, invitation of domain experts and expenses for venues all around the world. Collaboration of IOG on this challenge is expected, though not certain if possible. I can agree with this challenge to be feasible if the budget of 1 million USD is accepted.
f6_assessments.q2: Key metrics listed are well-defined. Out of the 4 metrics, I suggest to define the first one, 'clear identification of topics, as primary one and needed for every project submitted.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge aligns with Fund 8 Strategic Goal of prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than 1 of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The ability to travel and meet in person is highly dependent upon Covid restrictions at the time of the micro-summit. The challenge seeks to fund micro-summits for the entire year of 2022, which means that every micro-summit for the year will need to be determined by proposals during Fund 8, even though the issues needing to be addressed later in the year may not even be known yet. The funding request should be broken down into smaller requests each fund so that the micro-summit proposals can address more timely issues.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are measurable and well defined. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0: There are a lot of similar projects out there at the moment and each has its own pros and cons. So it will be a big waste if these projects are not combined to optimize resources. This challenge, if chosen, would be a great way for people with similar ideas to learn from each other or even collaborate, bringing together many similar projects into a larger, more complete project.
f6_assessments.q1: First, the existing Catalyst community already has many similar projects by solving common challenges. Second, the Catalyst community has experience in hosting similar events. Therefore, the community can successfully organize Enabling Micro-Summits as proposed is entirely possible and within our reach.
f6_assessments.q2: They key metrics is well-defined and easy to follow because they are clear and not include anything too general or blur.

importance: 小型的、高度专注的、跨学科的微峰会可以成为促进我们共同学习曲线的有效和高效的解决方案。
success: 优化投资回报率，避免冗余，加速联合、跨学科的学习
